commit_list.message:
Fix for external generators extend Erb::Generators

HAML and probably other generators extend this class and invoke
filename_with_extensions with the old signature (without format).
This makes the second argument optional and defaults it to the #format
method which could be overridden as well.

Closes #14132.

commit_list.message:
Adds JsonObject for Ruby<->JSON conversions

Handles:
* Key names to JSON camelCase conventions
* JSON to Ruby keys as snake_case
* Sanitizes keys for JSON

USAGE:

obj         = JsonMessage::JsonObject.new(structure)
json_string = obj.to_s
structure   = JsonMessage::JsonObject.parse(json_string)
obj         = JsonMessage::JsonObject.new(json_string)
structure   = obj.value

ruby -r qmail 'Qmail.command' from@example.com to@example.com ...

commit_list.message:
Fix for external generators extend Erb::Generators

HAML and probably other generators extend this class and invoke
filename_with_extensions with the old signature (without format).
This makes the second argument optional and defaults it to the #format
method which could be overridden as well.

Closes #14132.

Fixes #15 Cursor#fetch ignores symbolize_keys option

If you want to use gem without the "each_*" iterators, call
cursor.fetch to get the next row.

    row = cursor.fetch(symbolize_keys: true)

This option will make fetch return a hash of symbolized keys

commit_list.message:
Adjusts gemspec and travis for Jruby and Rubinious

Jruby database adapters are not ready for Rails 5
so we'll run Rails 4.2 on Jruby until they are ready

Rubineous 3.5.0 (just released) bills itself as
ruby 2.2.0, and Rails 5 demands 2.2.2 or later.
Since Rails 5 is still beta, I'll wait until things
get sorted out upstream to re-implement rbx.

commit_list.message:
Updates Commit 17bc577 for Missing MX Hosts

Interesting:

    EmailAddress.new("a@yahoo.wtf").host.exchangers.mxers

yahoo.wtf has an empty hostname in the MX record, which is wierd.

    yahoo.wtf.		804	IN	MX	0 .

Looking up the IP address for an empty hostname returned:

  IPSocket::getaddress("")
                            #=> "0.0.0.0"   # MRI
                            #=> "127.0.0.1" # Jruby

This caused Jruby run to fail in Travis CI. While they return
different values, I would lean towards 0.0.0.0 being more correct
(unassigned IP) per RFC3300, and not resolving to the loopback address.

That said, a valid hostname is required for an MX record. If an empty or
unresolvable hostname is returned, it shouldn't be included in the
result set of MX IP's. (Invalid/Unknown ones raise a SocketError and have
been excluded already.)

Host validation requires at least 1 MX IP (for the dns_lookup=:mx rule)
and should still work as expected. Badly configured domains shouldn't
be considered valid. This *could* be a temporary condition, but what
should we do here in that case?

truthy, so it now returns a boolean.

commit_list.message:
Fixes #13 Spaces in domain should be invalid

Spaces in the domain are invalid, but the library "cleans" the address by
downcasing and removing spaces from the domain.

These "helpers" have been a problem before and should be opted into.

I should not "fix" the address by removing spaces unless
host_remove_spaces:true is set.

EmailAddress.new("asdf@YA hoo.com").to_s #=> "asdf@yahoo.com"
EmailAddress.valid?("asdf@YA hoo.com") #=> false
EmailAddress.valid?("asdf@YA hoo.com", host_remove_spaces:true) #=> true
